column4: guys when i restarted x it says that fatal error, no screens found. i now have to work through command prompt....help!!
have you install beryl, compiz, or set your xorg.conf file
yeah, well i have beryl, and i also edited my xorg.conf because my terminal wasnt working properly.
sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
trooperi, how much data will it download,
none
trooperi, will i lose beryl??
you should have configure your xorg.conf file that you should have start your x
trooperi, i didnt get what you said
nvidia, ati?
intel
and i didnt make any changes in the file for installing beryl
...wait.. i get some information of that
trooperi, you got something??
im searching
maybe i should just use the command that you gave]
use this sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg
and answer yes if its ask something
after i run the command will it do the rest automatically??
yes..
troopperi, thanks for helping a newbie like me. i will boot into ubunut and try it out now
ok
